subject: Technology
title: Yuri Gagarin: First Human in Space
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Yuri Gagarin: First Human in Space.

hook.text: On April 12, 1961, Yuri Gagarin climbed into a tiny capsule and became the first human to orbit Earth.

buildup.text: The Vostok 1 mission lasted 108 minutes. Gagarin had almost no control. The flight was fully automatic.

discovery.text: Looking down, Gagarin said: 'The Earth is blue. How wonderful. It is amazing.'

twist.text: His reentry was terrifying. The capsule spun wildly and a module failed to detach on time.

climax.text: Gagarin ejected and parachuted to a field. A farmer and her daughter were the first to see him land.

punchline.text: The first spacefarer landed in a farmer's field.

quiz.question: How long did Yuri Gagarin's first spaceflight last?
